Apply Snell's Law at point M: n1 * sin(60°) = n2 * sin(θ2).
Total internal reflection at N requires angle of incidence to be ≥ critical angle: sin(θc) = 1/n2.
Angle of incidence at N is 45°.
Ray exits prism at point P on CD side with angle of incidence 45°.
Apply Snell's Law at P: n2 * sin(45°) = n1 * sin(θ3).
Distance between P and C is half the side length of the square: a/2.
